summary: The National Tea and Coffee Development Board Act of 2049 was amended in 2050. The amendment includes provisions for the verification and publication date, as well as amendments to the Nepal Law Codification Act of 2066. The Act aims to modernize and improve the quality of tea and coffee production in Nepal through the establishment of a National Tea and Coffee Development Board. The Board will work towards developing a strategic plan for the industry and ensuring effective management in both private and public sectors.

summary: The text discusses the National Dalit Commission Act of 2074 and its amendments, focusing on the protection and empowerment of the Dalit community in Nepal. The Act outlines the duties and rights of the Commission, including reviewing policies, conducting assessments, and recommending legal reforms to the government for the protection and empowerment of the Dalit community. The Act also defines key terms such as "Chairperson," "Dalit Community," and "Member." The Commission is tasked with studying and recommending measures for the protection and empowerment of the Dalit community to the government.

summary: The text discusses the National Dairy Development Board Act of 2048, which was amended by the Nepal Law Amendment Act of 2055. It establishes the National Dairy Development Board to promote coordination between government and private sectors in the dairy industry for increased milk production and public health. The Board is empowered to acquire, manage, and sell movable and immovable property, as well as to formulate dairy business policies and development programs at the national level.

summary: The text discusses the National Parks and Wildlife Conservation Act of 2029, along with subsequent amendments. It emphasizes the protection and conservation of natural habitats and wildlife, as well as the importance of sustainable development. The Act was enacted with the approval of the National Panchayat under the reign of King Mahendra. It defines and regulates the protection of national parks, wildlife, and their habitats. The Act also includes provisions for strengthening and amending certain Nepalese laws related to conservation and environmental protection.

summary: The text discusses the National Parks and Wildlife Conservation Regulations of 2030, along with subsequent amendments in 2032, 2035, 2042, 2070, 2074, and 2076 in Nepal. These regulations govern the protection and conservation of flora and fauna, including the establishment of wildlife rescue centers and hospitals. The document outlines the definitions and responsibilities of various authorities involved in wildlife conservation efforts.
